content: Locate the exact intersection point of the Arctic Circle and the International Date Line.

The Arctic Circle and the International Date Line intersect in the Arctic Ocean. The International Date Line is approximately along the 180th meridian, but it deviates in certain places to accommodate political and geographic considerations. The Arctic Circle is located at approximately 66.5 degrees north latitude.

The exact intersection point is at 66.5°N latitude and 180° longitude. However, due to the International Date Line's deviations, this can vary slightly based on the specific mapping or geopolitical context used. In general, it occurs in a remote area of the Arctic Ocean, far from any landmass.
